**The Idol of Moloch** is the [Infidel](/wiki/Infidel "Infidel") [quest artifact](/wiki/Quest_artifact "Quest artifact") in [EvilHack](/wiki/EvilHack "EvilHack") and [Hack'EM](/wiki/Hack%27EM "Hack'EM"). It is the prize for completing the [Infidel quest](/wiki/Infidel_quest "Infidel quest"), and is [chaotic](/wiki/Chaotic "Chaotic") for [wishing](/wiki/Wish "Wish") purposes. Its [base item](/wiki/Base_item "Base item") type is a [figurine](/wiki/Figurine "Figurine") of a [horned devil](/wiki/Horned_devil "Horned devil").

## Description

When carried, The Idol of Moloch grants [magic resistance](/wiki/Magic_resistance "Magic resistance") and [half spell damage](/wiki/Half_spell_damage "Half spell damage"), and Infidels additionally gain improved [energy](/wiki/Energy "Energy") regeneration similar to [The Eye of the Aethiopica](/wiki/The_Eye_of_the_Aethiopica "The Eye of the Aethiopica"), with the amount of enhanced regeneration depending on their [alignment record](/wiki/Alignment_record "Alignment record"): piously "unaligned" Infidels will get the most energy regeneration from the Idol, while Infidels in bad standing with Moloch (or [serving another god](/wiki/Helm_of_opposite_alignment "Helm of opposite alignment")) see no change in energy regeneration.

Invoking The Idol of Moloch while standing on an aligned [altar](/wiki/Altar "Altar") will instantly convert it to an altar to Moloch, while invoking it on any other square or else [applying](/wiki/Apply "Apply") it summons a random [major demon](/wiki/Major_demon "Major demon") without using up the figurine; both are subject to the same invocation timer. If the Idol is cursed, it will occasionally generate a random major demon on its own, similar to a normal cursed figurine and with the same odds of hostility (i.e., 80% chance of a hostile demon, 10% chance of a tame one, and 10% chance of a peaceful one).

### Infidels and the Idol

For Infidels, the Idol is immune to [cancellation](/wiki/Cancellation "Cancellation"), and is indestructible like other [unique items](/wiki/Unique_item "Unique item"): it cannot be placed into a [container](/wiki/Container "Container"), lost permanently in open [air](/wiki/Air "Air"), or [disintegrated](/wiki/Disintegrate "Disintegrate") by any means. The goal of an Infidel is to bring both the Idol and the [Amulet of Yendor](/wiki/Amulet_of_Yendor "Amulet of Yendor") to the [high priest](/wiki/High_priest "High priest") in [Moloch's Sanctum](/wiki/Moloch%27s_Sanctum "Moloch's Sanctum") and offer the Amulet on the high altar there - Moloch will then imbue the Idol with the Amulet's power, and the Idol must be brought to the correct high altar on the [Astral Plane](/wiki/Astral_Plane "Astral Plane") and invoked upon it, giving Moloch dominion over Heaven and all the Gods.

To this end, if the quest is completed without incident, the Archbishop will give you one of the hints regarding which high altar in the [Astral Plane](/wiki/Astral_Plane "Astral Plane") to *avoid* invoking the imbued Idol of Moloch on; the high priest of Moloch provides the other hint. If the Archbishop demands the Idol of Moloch from you due to [alignment record](/wiki/Alignment_record "Alignment record") abuse, they will become hostile *regardless* of whether you comply with their request, so either way you can keep or re-obtain the Idol if you survive the fight; the high priest will give you both hints if the Archbishop is dead.

Once the Idol is imbued, it suppresses the [HP](/wiki/HP "HP")-draining spellcasting and non-regeneration effects that normally occur if an Infidel does not have the Amulet of Yendor, though [teleportation](/wiki/Teleportation "Teleportation") is still suppressed as with the carried Amulet. From there, the Infidel begins their [ascension run](/wiki/Ascension_run "Ascension run") to the [Elemental Planes](/wiki/Elemental_Planes "Elemental Planes"), and on the Astral Plane must battle their way to the correct high altar, as determined by the hints mentioned previously - selecting the wrong altar will subject you to that god's wrath, up to and including [wide-angle disintegration beams](/wiki/Wide-angle_disintegration_beam "Wide-angle disintegration beam"), while selecting the right altar will end the game in Moloch's victory and your [ascension](/wiki/Ascension "Ascension") to archfiend status.

## Strategy

For non-Infidels, The Idol of Moloch is a chaotic artifact wish that offers slotless magic resistance - it can also provide a source of unlimited pets if blessed, though it will blast the user with each application.
